channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed - October 09, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
The Argentine peso, and Javier Milei, are in trouble — The Economist

The president’s economic team has decamped to Washington, trying desperately to confirm American support

Trump is turning the ‘war on drugs’ from metaphor into an actual war — The Washington Post

Beyond the question of whether blowing up boats off Venezuela is legal, what’s the military objective?

Can Satellites Stop an Avocado Addiction From Killing Mexican Forests? — The New York Times

A new program using satellite imagery seeks to raise pressure on avocado growers by getting support from American buyers.

Brazil’s Bolsonaro was convicted but the military appetite for a coup lingers — The Guardian

Armed forces academies teach troops that military control would be better for the country, historians and experts say Hours after supporters of the former president Jair Bolsonaro ransacked Brasília on 8 January 2023, three electricity pylons were brought down in different locations, between 1,000 miles and 1,800 miles away from Brazil’s capital. In the following days, 21 more towers were toppled, all using the same method: bolts were removed from the base, and supporting steel cables were cut. The perpetrators knew exactly which power lines to sever to cause the most harm to the electricity supply. Continue reading...
